moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: my favorite defense. An almost natural one
moves.7... Nbd7: my natural move would be Be7, but theory seems to prefer this move, so, I decided to obey as I am not very familiar to this opening.
moves.8... Be7 9. g3: I am not sure this is usual, but now that Q is on e2...
moves.9... Qc7: freeing space for the queen, exposing it to the threat that will come with the sacrifice of a knight
moves.10... b5: provoking the knights. Of course, the main goal is b4.
moves.11. O-O-O: regular move, but now it will result as a weakness.
moves.11... Bb7: Pointing the conflict on the center and forcing white to consider a1 as a weakness.
moves.12. Ndxb5: announced sacrifice. Will it be correct?
moves.12... axb5 13. Nxb5 Qc6: I hesitated with Qa5, but I didn't see any advantage. I foresaw that I had at least one move of freedom, due to the double threat: Rxa2 and Qxe4: white can only cover one.
moves.14. Bxf6: projecting the reflexion to next move.
moves.15. e5: very strange... but ok, i thought
moves.15... dxe5 16. Qxe5: and here, I realized there were a multiplication of threats on c7. And if I take a2, Qb8+ is very dangerous.
moves.17. Bd3: White disconsiders a2. I thought a lot about consequences on a2. I had good perspectives.
moves.19. Na3: mistake, probably due to the fact white did not imagine the following moves.
moves.19... Bxa3 20. bxa3 Ra2xa3: loses a new pawn, but there is worse for white.
moves.21. Kc1: Of course: queen can now check.
moves.22... Qg2+: but queen preferred this place: many possibilities here. White is crumbling.
moves.23. Be2: Rc3 would expose the king to the knight and loses the bishop.
moves.24... Ne4+: the last soldier will participate to the pillage.
moves.25. Ke3: 25 Kc1 Ra1+ 26 Kb2 Ra8 would lose time for black. Better would be just to take the bishop, which is the (bad) reason wqhy white preferred to play on e3.
moves.25... Qf2+: every check is necessary to avoid the possibility of a ountergame. But, frankly, it was note very plausible, unless black forgets to 1) keep the rook on line 8 2) protect the rook.
moves.26... Rd8+: the rook is all right here.
moves.27... Qxe2+: "there is no escape. Don't make me destroy you".
moves.28... Qxd1: Hey! No check here!... it was no more necessary.
